scrabble

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • scrabble.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that represents a player. A Player has a name, a score and a rack of letters to play with.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    George Piskas

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(java.lang.String playerName)
      Creates a player with the given name.
      Player(java.lang.String playerName, int rackSize)
      Creates a player with the given name.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String playerName)
        Creates a player with the given name. Also, score is set to 0 and a default rack is created.
        Parameters:
        playerName - name of the player

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String playerName,
      int rackSize)
        Creates a player with the given name. Also, score is set to 0 and a custom sized rack is created.
        Parameters:
        playerName - name of the player
        rackSize - size of player's rack

    • Method Detail

      • actChangeLetters

        public void actChangeLetters(java.util.ArrayList<Letter> returnedLtrs)
        PLayer requests to exchange a list of letters with others from the letter bag.
        Parameters:
        returnedLtrs - an ArrayList of letters the player returns to the bag

      • actPass

        public void actPass()
        Player does nothing.

      • actPlayLetters

        public int actPlayLetters(java.util.ArrayList<Letter> usedLetters)
        Player requests to play a list of letter from his rack on the board. The player then gets new letters, if avaliable in the bag.
        Parameters:
        usedLetters - an ArrayList of letters the player places on the board
        Returns:
        -1: did not play | 0: play | 1: play +50 extra points

      • addToScore

        public void addToScore(int points)
        Adds the given points to the current score.
        Parameters:
        points - points to add to player's score

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the player's name.

        the player's name

      • getScore

        public int getScore()
        Returns the player's score.

        public void setName(java.lang.String theName)
        Sets the player's name.
